title: California Partnership Agreement
description: Comprehensive partnership agreement for California businesses. Defines roles, responsibilities, profit sharing, and dispute resolution.

placeholders.name: business_purpose
placeholders.label: Business Purpose
placeholders.placeholder: Description of the partnership's business activities

content.html:
PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT

This Partnership Agreement (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of {{effective_date}} (the "Effective Date") by and between the undersigned parties.

PARTIES

Partner 1: {{partner1_name}}
Address: {{partner1_address}}

Partner 2: {{partner2_name}}
Address: {{partner2_address}}

Hereby agree to form a general partnership under the laws of the State of California.

1. PARTNERSHIP NAME AND PURPOSE

The partnership shall be known as "{{partnership_name}}" (the "Partnership"). The primary business purpose of the Partnership shall be {{business_purpose}}.

2. CAPITAL CONTRIBUTIONS

The Partners shall contribute an initial total capital of ${{initial_capital}}. Profits and losses shall be shared according to the ratio of {{profit_sharing}} between Partner 1 and Partner 2 respectively.

3. MANAGEMENT AND AUTHORITY

Both Partners shall have equal authority to manage and bind the Partnership in ordinary business matters. Major decisions requiring unanimous consent include: (a) admission of new partners; (b) sale of Partnership assets; (c) incurring debt beyond $10,000; (d) amendment of this Agreement.

4. DUTIES OF PARTNERS

Each Partner shall devote reasonable time and attention to Partnership business, act in good faith, and maintain accurate books and records.

5. ACCOUNTING

Partnership shall maintain fiscal year ending December 31. Annual financial statements shall be prepared and provided to each Partner within 90 days of year-end.

6. DISTRIBUTIONS

Profits shall be distributed quarterly or as otherwise agreed by the Partners. No distributions shall be made if Partnership liabilities exceed assets.

7. TERM AND TERMINATION

This Agreement shall continue until terminated by: (a) mutual agreement of Partners; (b) death or incapacity of a Partner; (c) bankruptcy of a Partner; or (d) expiration of specified term.

8. DISSOLUTION

Upon termination, Partnership assets shall be liquidated, debts paid, and remaining assets distributed according to profit-sharing ratio.

9. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

Disputes shall first be addressed through good faith negotiations. If unresolved, parties shall pursue mediation before litigation.

10. GOVERNING LAW

This Agreement shall be governed by California law, excluding conflict of law principles.

{{partner1_name}}
{{partner2_name}}
Date
